overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence on Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, primarily focusing on research related to social media, disinformation, and computational social science. LinkedIn has the largest follower base, while Bluesky shows a high level of engagement related to research publications and opportunities.

contentThemes.description: Posts related to research papers, grants, and methodological discussions in computational social science.
Content focused on detecting and analyzing disinformation campaigns and coordinated inauthentic behavior on social media.
Posts advertising research positions, PhD opportunities, and calls for collaboration.

recommendations: Cross-promote content across platforms to maximize reach and engagement.
Use platform-specific features (e.g., LinkedIn articles, Mastodon polls) to encourage interaction.
Engage with comments and replies to foster a sense of community.
Schedule posts strategically to optimize for peak audience activity times on each platform.
Incorporate visuals and multimedia to increase content appeal and shareability.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky is effectively used to share research publications and opportunities, fostering engagement within the computational social science community. High repost rates suggest content resonates well with the audience.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon serves as a platform for sharing project updates and participating in methodological discussions. Moderate engagement levels indicate a need to explore content formats that drive more interaction.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn demonstrates a strong professional network, with posts related to grant announcements and job openings achieving high engagement. Leverage LinkedIn for professional networking and career-related content.
